greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by rows in which each row describes in words the composition of the previous row.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Onno M. Cain and Sela T. Enin, Inventory Loops (i.e. Counting Sequences) have Pre-period 2 max S_1 + 60, arXiv:2004.00209 [math.NT], 2020.
example: Explanation: look at 3 1 1 2. What do you see? Two 1's, one 2 and one 3, so the next row is 2 1 1 2 1 3.
mathematica: RunLengthEncode[x_List ] := (Through[ { Length, First}[ #1 ] ] &) /@ Split[ Sort[ x ]]; LookAndSay[ n_, d_:1 ] := NestList[ Flatten[ RunLengthEncode[ # ] ] &, {d}, n - 1 ]; F[n_] := LookAndSay[ n, 1 ][[ n ]]; Flatten[ Table[ F[n], {n, 18}]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 22 2004 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, based on a query from Chasity Engle, Jan 20 2004
ext: More terms from _Wouter Meeussen_ and _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 22 2004
